XRoles

The XRoles entity is used to add different roles that might be required for a particular project. These roles will be applied to the different users as and when the users are added.

Adding new roles

To add new roles that you would need for different user of your project ,

  1. Select the XRoles entity. The XRoles list window is displayed.
  2. Select Add. The Add xroles window is displayed.
  3. Enter Name and Description for the specific role. These fields are mandatory.
  4. Click Save. The new role is now added to your project.

Deleting roles

If a Role is to be removed, you can delete the user from the list.

To delete a role:

  1. Under XRoles list, click to select the role to be deleted.
  2. Click Delete. The selected role is deleted. If you select multiple roles and click Delete, the roles will be deleted from the list.

    Note:

    1. In case you do not select a role, an error message is displayed stating “XRole not selected”.

Editing roles

You can edit the details for a specific role including the policies, applications and visibilities to be applied to the roles. Using the Edit function, you can also add and modify the other entities. These entities represent the one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many relationship that exists between the entities. To edit the role details, under xroles list, select the role from the list and click Edit. The Edit xroles window appears. Using the edit function, the following entities / functionalities can be applied:

  1. Applications: Not all applications can be used for all roles. Different applications can be applied to any role.
    1. To apply any application to a role, under XRoles > Edit, select Applications
    2. Click Add. Enter the details for Name and Description.
    3. Click Save.
  2. Visibilities: The Visibilities entity is used to define the different entities, functions and modules that would be visible to the specific user.
    1. To assign a visibility, under XUser > Edit, select Visibilities.
    2. Click Add. Enter the details for Name and Description.
    3. Click Save.
  3. Policies: There are various policies defined for different users, user groups and user’s roles. Certain rights and rules will be assigned to the user based on the policy applied.
    1. To assign a Policy, under XUser > Edit, select Policies.
    2. Click Add. Enter the Priority and Policy.
    3. Click Save. The policies selected are then assigned to the user.

Refresh

For all entities you will be able to Refresh that page to reflect the latest data and functions applicable for the entity.
